intro.description: This cheat sheet shows you how to explore a CollabNet Subversion repository and check out a project. If you need help at any step, click on the (?) icon to the right.

item.title: Open the CollabNet perspective
item.description: From the main menu, select Window > Open Perspective > Other..., then select the CollabNet perspective.

item.title: Add a CollabNet Subversion Repository
item.description:
In the CollabNet Sites view, click on the Add CollabNet Site toolbar button. Choose CollabNet Subversion Repository in the site type dropdown. Then provide a description for the repository connection and the URL to the root of your repository. For example, for the Subclipse repository, enter the following:
Description: Subclipse
URL: http://subclipse.tigris.org/svn/subclipse/
Type: CollabNet Subversion Repository
NOTE: Your credentials are managed by CollabNet Subversion. You will be prompted for them when they are needed and you will have the option to allow CollabNet Subversion to cache those credentials.
Click Finish.

item.title: Locate the project
item.description: Expand the newly added repository, and locate the project you wish to check out.

item.title: Check out the project
item.description: Right click on the project you wish to check out and select Checkout. This will launch the Checkout wizard which will guide you through the rest of the process.

item.title: View the workspace
item.description: To see the project in your workspace, switch to the Resource perspective via Window > Open Perspective > Resource to see the project in the Navigator view. You can now view and work with the contents of the project.
